content:
Get-AzureADServicePrincipalOwner

Get the owner of a service principal.

Syntax

Get-AzureADServicePrincipalOwner [-All <Boolean>] -ObjectId <String> [-Top <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

Description

The Get-AzureADServicePrincipalOwner cmdlet gets the owners of a service principal in Azure Active Directory (AD).

Examples

Example 1: Retrieve the owner of a service principal

PS C:\> $ServicePrincipalId = (Get-AzureADServicePrincipal -Top 1).ObjectId
PS C:\> Get-AzureADServicePrincipalOwner -ObjectId $ServicePrincipalId

The first command gets the ID of a service principal by using the Get-AzureADServicePrincipal cmdlet. The command stores the ID in the $ServicePrincipalId variable.

The second command gets the owner of a service principal identified by $ServicePrincipalId.

Parameters

-All

If true, return all service principal owners for this service principal. If false, return the number of objects specified by the Top parameter

Type:Boolean
Required:False
Position:Named
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters:False
-ObjectId

Specifies the ID of a service principal in Azure AD.

Type:String
Required:True
Position:Named
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters:False
-Top

Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

Type:Int32
Required:False
Position:Named
Default value:None
Accept pipeline input:True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters:False

Related Links

  • Add-AzureADServicePrincipalOwner
  • Get-AzureADServicePrincipal
  • Remove-AzureADServicePrincipalOwner
